forum.name: T1D1 Discussion: Participant Introductions and Goals
forum.intro:
[For Topics 2, 4, and 6 goal instructions, see below]

Topic 1: Please post your introduction to course participants and facilitator(s). In your post, please include:

  1. An introduction to yourself that includes:
    • Your name, where you are from, and what your role in your program is
    • A bit about the students you serve (or your program serves)
    • A little about your current experience with assessment.
  1. At least one goal that you would like to achieve by taking this course. You will have the opportunity to revise your goal in later lessons.

After you post, please take time to review others' introductions in the discussion, and post at least one reply in response.

Note: This item will automatically mark itself complete on the main course outline once you have submitted a post.

Topics 2, 4, and 6 goal instructions

Topic 2 Discussion Tasks – Revisit Your Goals

  • Once you have completed all tasks for Topic 2, REPLY to YOUR original post with any revisions to your course goals.

Topic 4 Discussion Task  - Review and Report on Your Goals

  • Once you have completed all tasks for Topic 4, REPLY to YOUR original post with an update on your course goals.

Topic 6 Discussion Task  - Final Goals Report

  • Once you have completed all required course Tasks, REPLY to YOUR original post with a final report on your course goals. Have you met your goal(s)?  Why or why not?
  • Once you have posted a reply with your final report, review other’s goal updates and ask questions about their stated results.

To Post your INITIAL GOALS to Discussions:

  1. Click on "Add a new discussion topic"  near the bottom of the course window. You should now see a new section titled "Your new discussion topic." You may have to scroll down to see it.
  2. Type your message subject. Insert a description of your post in the subject line.
  3. Type your message information.  In the message box, type your responses to the discussion prompt.* [Remember, your answer will be seen by all other course participants.]
  4. Save your post. When you are finished typing your introduction, click on the "Post to Forum" button.
  5. To Read others' posts, click on the subject line of the post you wish to read.
  6. To Reply, click on The Reply link in the lower right hand corner of your own or a peer's post. Then type your message and click on "Post to Forum" as in #s 3 & 4 above.

*Note - To make sure you don't lose your work, you may wish to compose your post in a text program (like MS Word or an e-mail) and save it there 1st. Then return to the course and copy and paste your thoughts into the posting box.

Once You Have Completed Your Post:

Click on the Intro-Assessment-ABE link at the top (or at left under "my Courses") to return to the Course Outline and access the next course activity.
